ruleset.name: Java Logging
ruleset.description: The Java Logging ruleset contains a collection of rules that find questionable usages of the logger.

rule.name: MoreThanOneLogger
rule.message: Class contains more than one logger.
rule.description: Normally only one logger is used in each class.

rule.name: LoggerIsNotStaticFinal
rule.message: The Logger variable declaration does not contain the static and final modifiers
rule.description: In most cases, the Logger reference can be declared as static and final.

rule.name: SystemPrintln
rule.description: References to System.(out|err).print are usually intended for debugging purposes and can remain in the codebase even in production code. By using a logger one can enable/disable this behaviour at will (and by priority) and avoid clogging the Standard out log.

rule.name: AvoidPrintStackTrace
rule.message: Avoid printStackTrace(); use a logger call instead.
rule.description: Avoid printStackTrace(); use a logger call instead.
